study_info.title: Post-surgical natural history of MEN2A with RET C634R mutation and bilateral cervical node metastasis: a case report
study_info.country: Nepal (inferred from CMCTH; not explicitly stated, so set to null)

biochemical_data.reference_range: Intact PTH within normal range (exact not provided)

imaging: CECT Neck (2013): heterogeneously enhancing bilateral multifocal thyroid nodules with lymph node involvement in right cervical nodes (level 3/4), right pretracheal nodes, and paratracheal nodes
MIBG scan (1 month post-thyroidectomy): bilateral adrenal pheochromocytoma and faint tracer uptake in left neck
Ultrasound 4 years after thyroidectomy: hypoechoic nodules with microcalcifications in the left central region
CECT Neck at 4 years: enhancing lesion in left thyroid bed
PET-CT: somatostatin receptor-expressing soft tissue lesions and lymph nodes in left paratracheal region
CECT Chest and Abdomen: no distant metastasis; dermoid ovarian cyst noted
pathology: Fine-needle aspiration cytology in 2013 diagnostic of medullary thyroid carcinoma
Bilateral cervical lymph node metastases at initial surgery
Lymph node pathology: 2/3 right cervical nodes positive, 1/3 left cervical nodes positive, 4/4 pre-tracheal nodes positive
Final staging (10 years after diagnosis): Stage IVA, T2N1bM0 (ATA 2015 guidelines)
Parathyroid glands uninvolved clinically (no primary hyperparathyroidism reported)

genetics.zygosity: heterozygous (assumed for germline MEN2A; not explicitly stated so treated as null)

family_history.details: Mother had thyroidectomy for unknown cause; sibling underwent prophylactic thyroidectomy without MEN2A detected; 7-year-old daughter carries the same RET C634R mutation

surgery: Total thyroidectomy with central node dissection and bilateral functional neck dissection (2013, at age 26)
Laparoscopic right total adrenalectomy and left partial adrenalectomy for bilateral pheochromocytoma (7 months after thyroidectomy)
follow_up: Regular monitoring of TSH, T4, PTH, calcitonin, CEA, and pheochromocytoma markers
Euthyroid on 100 mcg levothyroxine once daily at follow-up
Persistent elevation of basal calcitonin at all measured timepoints from 1 month to 5 years post-op
CEA became elevated to 28.9 ng/mL during later follow-up despite absence of new symptoms
Normotensive with no headaches, palpitations, diaphoresis, weight loss, or muscle spasms at latest follow-up

methods.sequencing_panel: Genetic analysis for RET C634R germline mutation (exact platform not specified)
methods.biomarker_assays: Serum calcitonin, CEA, TSH, T4, parathyroid hormone, vanillylmandelic acid, and urinary metanephrines measured using unspecified standard clinical laboratory methods

normal_ranges.pth: Within laboratory normal range (exact not reported)
normal_ranges.vma: Within laboratory normal range (values not reported)
normal_ranges.metanephrines: Within laboratory normal range (values not reported)
